column4: Why does Ubuntu download packages during installation?  Isn't everything on the CD?
But I didn't check the option to download updates.
So why would it download them anyway?
And last question... Is PulseAudio working ok for you guys?
I cannot play World of Warcraft anymore using Wine with whatever PulseAudio changes happened between 10.4 and 10.10
The sound lasts about 30 seconds, starts stuttering and then just quits entirely.
do you use Alsa instead of Pulse Audio?
It's all stable and good even after removing PulseAudio?
there are some soundcards that require pulseaudio for full use, though

I could be wrong, but it seems to me that PulseAudio is lagging my whole system.  I get lots of messages in /Var/Logs/Messages and the system gets periods of sluggishness for a few seconds and then it just goes away.  Like I could type, and my input is being buffered and not displayed.  After a few seconds, everything catches up.  I want to see if this is PulseAudio causing this.
unfortunately, pulseaudio hasn't been designed within ubuntu very well to do proper detection, it just blindly assumes that it will work
pulseaudio is a daemon, not a kernel module. it sits on top of alsa, basically
